title: 6 Linkable Asset Types (And EXACTLY How to Earn Links With Them)
description: Linkable assets are awesome pieces of content that can be leveraged for links. But did you know that most successful linkable assets tend to be similar "types" of content? In this post, I'll explore six linkable asset types, and explain how you can easily earn links with them.
content: Joshua Hardwick Head of Content @ Ahrefs (or, in plain English, I'm the guy responsible for ensuring that every blog post we publish is EPIC). Then you probably donâ€™t have anything on your website particularly deserving of links.The truth is: there are certain â€œtypesâ€ of content that earn links much more easily than others.These are known as â€œlinkable assets.â€Hereâ€™s what the backlink profile of a (very) successful linkable asset looks like:This is the link profile for â€œ13 reasons your brain craves infographicsâ€ by NeoMam.Pretty impressive, right!?But â€œlinkable assetsâ€ are not created solely to attract links. Check out ourBeginnerâ€™s guide to link buildingWhat is a â€œLinkable Assetâ€?A â€œlinkable assetâ€ is a piece of content purposely crafted with the intention of attracting linksâ€”usually from other websites in your niche.Because people rarely link to commercial content, â€œlinkable assetsâ€ are almost never product pages or commercial content of any kind.Some people also create â€œlinkable assetsâ€ with the intention of ranking for high-volume keywords. However, this only works if there is overlap between the topic of your â€œassetâ€ and one or more high-volume keywords (which isnâ€™t always the case).Hereâ€™s are some of the other benefits of attracting links:Increased organic search traffic (to other pages on your site): Linkable assets tend to attract a lot of â€œlink equityâ€ which you can then distribute to other pages on your site via internal links. But this is exactly what happens when you create a popular â€œlinkable asset.â€ This helps to spread the word about your brand and causes customers to associate your brand with cool things.Here is one great example of a very simple â€œlinkable assetâ€ that performed well and attracted tons of links.When this infographic was published, the number of referring domains shot up like a rocket!This page now receives an estimated 1,500 visits/month from organic search as it ranks for some pretty juicy keywords.You can also see a steady increase in sitewide organic search traffic since the infographic was published.Sidenote. But it almost certainly helped.But what makes a â€œlinkable assetâ€ so linkable?First, you need to understand why people tend to link to things. If you can understand that, you can then start building â€œlinking triggersâ€ into your content.Here are a few reasons people link to content:It provides a solution for a specific problem;It offers a unique angle towards a particular topic;It backs up a point theyâ€™re trying to make (in their existing article);It is something their audience would find interesting.Further readingDeconstructing Linkbait: How to Create Content That Attracts Backlinks13 Reasons Why Your Brain Craves InfographicsBut before we get to the asset â€œtypes,â€ itâ€™s important to understand that linkable assets donâ€™t attract links out of thin airâ€”you need to promote them to make this happen.Thatâ€™s why I included a mini how-to guide to building backlinks alongside each linkable asset â€œtypeâ€ below. ğŸ™‚But you might still be wondering:â€œWhy should I create a â€œlinkable assetâ€â€¦ canâ€™t I just promote my â€œregularâ€ content instead?â€Sure, you can. But hereâ€™s the critical point:Linkable assets have a much higher ROI on your promotion efforts because theyâ€™re created with attracting backlinks in mind. Or, to put it simply, youâ€™ll have an easier time building backlinks to a â€œlinkable assetâ€ than, say, an ecommerce page.So, without further ado, letâ€™s learn about the best types of linkable assets you can create (according to your goals and resources).1. Infographics, GIFographics & â€œMap-o-graphicsâ€Infographics are still one of the most popular content formats when it comes to creating â€œlinkable assets.â€ And itâ€™s easy to see why: they can attract a lot of links.Hereâ€™s a simple map-o-graphic that attracted links from 160+ referring domains:Further readingThe Visual Format You Should be Using for Link Building (No, Itâ€™s NOT Infographics)But itâ€™s important to note that infographics are not always the best option.
